Container.Name: SpeedFlux

Variable.Value: isp, external_ip, server_id, server_name, server_location, speedtest_url
Variable.Name: INFLUX_DB_TAGS

Config.Name: InfluxDB Address
Config.Description: Container Variable: INFLUX_DB_ADDRESS IP or Hostname of Influx DB

Config.Name: InfluxDB Database Name
Config.Description: Container Variable: INFLUX_DB_DATABASE If the database doesn't exist, it will be created.

Config.Name: Test Interval
Config.Description: How often should speed be tested, in minutes. Default is set at 2:30 as I like to see changes over time at different times of day.

Config.Name: InfluxDB Tags
Config.Default: isp, external_ip, server_id, server_name, server_location, speedtest_url
Config.Description: Tags to be added to the datasets. See https://github.com/breadlysm/speedtest-to-influxdb#tag-options. Tags must be comma seperated

Container.Config: isp, external_ip, server_id, server_name, server_location, speedtest_url

Config.Name: Ping Interval
Config.Description: Interval is in seconds. This is how often your latency will be checked.

Config.Name: Ping Servers
Config.Description: hostnames or domains to use to test ping. On every ping interval, all servers input will be tested. Must be comma seperated.

Config.Name: (Optional) Server ID
Config.Description: Input a Ookla Speedtest server ID to use for your tests. This will use this server for every test.

Container.Description:
This tool will continuosly run Speedtests at the chosen interval and export the data to InfluxDB.
# What makes this different is that it's using the Ookla CLI tool which provides some expanded details that you can use to tag your Influx Data.
An example of the dashboard I made in Grafana can be found at https://grafana.com/grafana/dashboards/13053.
This container only includes the scripts to run the speedtests and export to Influx. InfluxDB must be installed seperatly. I welcome feedback or additional improvements. Please open an issue on the project page.
